2023-08-20.Line 40: Entrance Hymn                                                       Psalm 67, O God, To Us Show Mercy
2023-08-20.Line 74: O Lord, we call upon all the earth to make a joyful shout to You, our God, to sing out the honor of Your name; to make Your praise glorious.  We would say to You, O Lord our God,  How awesome are Your works!  Through the greatness of Your power Your enemies shall submit themselves to You; they shall sing praises to Your name.  Receive the praises of Your humble servants as we offer them to You through the one sacrifice of Your Son, our Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, hear us as we sing the prayer our Lord Jesus has taught us
2023-08-20.Line 77: Our Father, who art in Heaven,
2023-08-20.Line 80: Thy will be done, on earth as it is in Heaven.
2023-08-20.Line 81: Give us this day our daily bread,
2023-08-20.Line 82: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive, our debtors.
2023-08-20.Line 83: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.
2023-08-20.Line 84: For Thine is the Kingdom, and the Power, and the Glory.
2023-08-20.Line 88: Saints of God, we are in need of cleansing and renewal. Let us call upon the mercy of our heavenly Father.  Let us kneel and confess our sins together, in humble reliance upon the grace of God, first silently, then together.
2023-08-20.Line 91: Let us pray together  Most merciful God, we confess that we have sinned against You in thought, word, and deed, by what we have done and by what we have left undone.  We have not loved You with our whole heart; we have not loved our neighbor as ourselves.  For the sake of Your Son, Jesus Christ, have mercy on us.  Forgive us, renew us, and lead us, so that we may delight in Your will and walk in Your ways, to the glory of Your holy name.  Amen.
2023-08-20.Line 95: Rise and Hear now God's assurance of forgiveness
2023-08-20.Line 97: Come and hear, all you who fear God, And I will declare what He has done for my soul. I cried to Him with my mouth, And He was extolled with my tongue. If I regard iniquity in my heart, The Lord will not hear. But certainly God has heard me; He has attended to the voice of my prayer. Blessed be God, Who has not turned away my prayer, Nor His mercy from me!
2023-08-20.Line 98: [Covenant people of God, the Lord has heard your cry; He has not turned away your prayer of confession, nor taken His mercy from You.  For the sake of Jesus Christ His Son, He forgives all your sin].
2023-08-20.Line 101: We lift them up to the Lord!
2023-08-20.Line 187: Keep justice, and do righteousness, For My salvation is about to come, And My righteousness to be revealed.
2023-08-20.Line 189: 6  Also the sons of the foreigner Who join themselves to the Lord, to serve Him, And to love the name of the Lord, to be His servants  Everyone who keeps from defiling the Sabbath, And holds fast My covenant  7 Even them I will bring to My holy mountain, And make them joyful in My house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices Will be accepted on My altar; For My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations. 8 The Lord God, who gathers the outcasts of Israel, says,  Yet I will gather to him Others besides those who are gathered to him.
2023-08-20.Line 197: 11 I say then, has God cast away His people? Certainly not! For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin. 2 God has not cast away His people whom He foreknew. Or do you not know what the Scripture says of Elijah, how he pleads with God against Israel, saying, 3  Lord, they have killed Your prophets and torn down Your altars, and I alone am left, and they seek my life? 4 But what does the divine response say to him?  I have reserved for Myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal. 5 Even so then, at this present time there is a remnant according to the election of grace. 6 And if by grace, then it is no longer of works; otherwise grace is no longer grace. But if it is of works, it is no longer grace; otherwise work is no longer work.
2023-08-20.Line 198: 7 What then? Israel has not obtained what it seeks; but the elect have obtained it, and the rest were blinded. 8 Just as it is written:
2023-08-20.Line 199: God has given them a spirit of stupor, Eyes that they should not see And ears that they should not hear, To this very day.
2023-08-20.Line 201: Let their table become a snare and a trap, A stumbling block and a recompense to them. 10 Let their eyes be darkened, so that they do not see, And bow down their back always.
2023-08-20.Line 202: 11 I say then, have they stumbled that they should fall? Certainly not! But through their fall, to provoke them to jealousy, salvation has come to the Gentiles. 12 Now if their fall is riches for the world, and their failure riches for the Gentiles, how much more their fullness!
2023-08-20.Line 203: 13 For I speak to you Gentiles; inasmuch as I am an apostle to the Gentiles, I magnify my ministry, 14 if by any means I may provoke to jealousy those who are my flesh and save some of them. 15 For if their being cast away is the reconciling of the world, what will their acceptance be but life from the dead?
2023-08-20.Line 204: 16 For if the firstfruit is holy, the lump is also holy; and if the root is holy, so are the branches. 17 And if some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive tree, were grafted in among them, and with them became a partaker of the root and fatness of the olive tree, 18 do not boast against the branches. But if you do boast, remember that you do not support the root, but the root supports you.
2023-08-20.Line 205: 19 You will say then,  Branches were broken off that I might be grafted in. 20 Well said. Because of unbelief they were broken off, and you stand by faith. Do not be haughty, but fear.
2023-08-20.Line 208: The Word of the Lord!   Thanks be to God!
2023-08-20.Line 262: (Please remain standing for our Gospel Lesson and song)
2023-08-20.Line 266: Praise be to the Lord Jesus Christ!
2023-08-20.Line 273: Glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Ghost!
2023-08-20.Line 274: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be.
2023-08-20.Line 278: Our Father, We feel our frailties this morning as we hear the words of Your Son revealing Himself to be the Bread of Life.  Guide us today as we open Your word so that we would no longer be like helpless children, tossed about by every gust of false teaching or error. Bring us to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to the full stature of Christ, So that, speaking the truth in love, we may grow up in all things into Him who is the Head Christ  in Whose Holy name we pray. Amen.
2023-08-20.Line 281: Preaching of the Word    Pastor Ben Rossell
2023-08-20.Line 394: " When you have finished laying aside all the tithe of your increase in the third year -- the year of tithing -- and have given it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, so that they may eat within your gates and be filled, then you shall say before the Lord your God: 'I have removed the holy tithe from my house, and also have given them to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, according to all Your commandments which You have commanded me; I have not transgressed Your commandments, nor have I forgotten them.'
2023-08-20.Line 397: after the example of Old Covenant Israel, we present our offerings to You this morning, a tithe and token removed from our houses and taken to Your House as a testimony of remembrance and thanksgiving for the increase You have entrusted to us, and of love for You and our neighbors.
2023-08-20.Line 399: We acknowledge that all things belongs to You, including we ourselves.  So bless them today for Your service.
2023-08-20.Line 401: In Jesus' name we pray.  AMEN.
2023-08-20.Line 410: (Please Stand for the Prayer for the Church and the World)
2023-08-20.Line 414: Gracious and Holy Father in Heaven,
2023-08-20.Line 416: Create in us clean hearts O God and restore right spirits within us.  Search us, try us, know us - see if there be any dishonest or harmful ways within us.  Purify us by Your Spirit and fill us so that the words of our mouths and the meditations of our hearts would be pleasing to You, and that by the fruit of our mouths this Church, our homes, our workplaces, and Your world would be filled with grace and truth.
2023-08-20.Line 417: We pray this not only for ourselves but for all Your Church in all the world.
2023-08-20.Line 418: In our own community, we lift up to You  Bluewater Community Church pastor Dean Allen and church planter Clint Akins.   Would You continue to grant them Your blessing, empower them to be wise and faithful in ministry and righteousness; to delight in You and Your Word and to live by faith as You have called us to.
2023-08-20.Line 420: Bless also Thomas and Julie and their family
2023-08-20.Line 421: 1. Praise God for the retreat that we had for the team that we are leading across the border. It was a sweet time of fellowship and team strategizing.
2023-08-20.Line 422: 2. Please lift up Thomas as he travels to Europe this coming week. Pray for smooth travels for him, and ask that the girls and I would have a wonderful time together during the time he is away.
2023-08-20.Line 423: 3. Please lift up our Singapore team as we have our final meeting together on August 29th. Pray that this team would continue to press on in faithfulness in our absence.
2023-08-20.Line 424: 4. Please lift up our girls as we say goodbye to friends here and prepare to make the transition to the U.S. for our six month stateside!
2023-08-20.Line 426: Outside of our community, we lift up to You our brothers and sisters in CHINA where Your people are targeted, attacked, and persecuted.  For our brothers and sisters in prison, harshly mistreated and neglected - Give them together with all Your Church there Your Own Spirit's power of unity and love especially Christian marriages and their children that they would be raised in the Lord.
2023-08-20.Line 427: Provide abundantly for all their needs and concerns and turn their enemies from their wickedness, frustrate their plans, confuse their attacks, and haunt their dreams continually.  Turn that great land to Your Light and bless it with the peace of a flourishing and faithful Chinese Church.
2023-08-20.Line 429: Father, also bless Your churches, ministers, refugees, and those caring for them in Russia, Ukraine, and border regions.  Bring a swift end to all hostilities and grant Your people across that region true unity in the Holy Spirit.
2023-08-20.Line 433: OH LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-08-20.Line 436: How kind You are, Dear Father, to be especially present with Your people in our sufferings, sanctifying them for our good and Your glory.
2023-08-20.Line 437: We lift up to You those who are afflicted by all manner of suffering.
2023-08-20.Line 463: As well as each one we name before You now in our silent prayers
2023-08-20.Line 465: We give You thanks for life itself and Your precious gift of new life.  We thank You for the safe birth of Andrew to Claire and Caleb Williams,
2023-08-20.Line 466: and ask Your continued health and blessing for mother and son as well as Your protection and provision for of our expecting mothers.
2023-08-20.Line 468: We give You thanks and ask Your protection for of our expectant mothers
2023-08-20.Line 469: Britney Schaeffer, Julie Alldredge, Sarah Mosley, Lauren Russo, Laura Dalton and Erika Dahl - together with their unborn children.
2023-08-20.Line 472: Hear also the prayers of those who desire children for the blessing of their homes and Your greater glory.
2023-08-20.Line 475: Good Shepherd, heal Your sheep and tend Your Lambs.
2023-08-20.Line 477: OH LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-08-20.Line 480: For You are gracious.We pray for the families of our congregation, that they may be strong and godly families and an example to the community. We pray particularly today for our singles and young adults and for our college students in various places whether here or living on their own.
2023-08-20.Line 481: We ask that You would grant them the grace of Your Spirit to fight the good fight of faith and fidelity.
2023-08-20.Line 482: To stand fast against temptation and pressures from without and within, not to tempt or presume upon You.
2023-08-20.Line 483: To establish and maintain the testimony of Christian integrity, purity, chastity, diligence, joy, faith, hope, and charity.
2023-08-20.Line 484: Grant them Your Spirit to comfort, convict, empower, and guide so that each would walk with You and so, day by day, and bear witness by their words and lives to the profound truth of the gospel of Christ Jesus their Lord.
2023-08-20.Line 486: LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-08-20.Line 488: And now, our Heavenly Father, as we approach Your Word and Table,
2023-08-20.Line 489: Give us ears to hear Your Word and hearts to receive Christ Jesus,
2023-08-20.Line 490: Who Himself delights to receive unworthy sinners such as ourselves.
2023-08-20.Line 491: For we pray in His strong and holy name.  Amen
2023-08-20.Line 496: Christians, in Whom do you trust?
2023-08-20.Line 499: I believe in one God: the Father Almighty,
2023-08-20.Line 501: and of all things visible and invisible;
2023-08-20.Line 503: And in one Lord, Jesus Christ, the only-begotten Son of God,
2023-08-20.Line 504: begotten of His Father before all worlds,
2023-08-20.Line 505: God of God, Light of Light, very God of very God,
2023-08-20.Line 507: being of one substance with the Father;
2023-08-20.Line 508: by Whom all things were made;
2023-08-20.Line 509: Who for us men, and for our salvation,
2023-08-20.Line 511: and was incarnate by the Holy Ghost of the virgin, Mary,
2023-08-20.Line 513: and was crucified also for us under Pontius Pilate;
2023-08-20.Line 516: He rose again according to the Scriptures;
2023-08-20.Line 518: and sitteth at the right hand of the Father;
2023-08-20.Line 519: and He shall come again with glory
2023-08-20.Line 520: to judge both the quick and the dead;
2023-08-20.Line 521: Whose kingdom shall have no end.
2023-08-20.Line 523: And I believe in the Holy Ghost, the Lord and Giver of life,
2023-08-20.Line 524: Who proceedeth from the Father and the Son;
2023-08-20.Line 525: Who with the Father and the Son
2023-08-20.Line 529: And I believe one, holy, catholic, and apostolic Church;
2023-08-20.Line 530: I acknowledge one baptism for the remission of sins;
2023-08-20.Line 531: and I look for the resurrection of the dead,
2023-08-20.Line 532: and the life of the world to come.
2023-08-20.Line 569: #6 THE LORD COMMUNES WITH US < The Peace Offering >
2023-08-20.Line 574: Prayer giving thanks for the bread #6: (Adapted from the Book of Common Prayer)
2023-08-20.Line 576: All glory be to You, Almighty God, our heavenly Father, because of Your tender mercy, You gave Your only Son Jesus Christ to suffer death on the cross for our redemption; Who on the cross by His one sacrifice of Himself, offered once-for-all, made a full, perfect, and sufficient satisfaction for our sins; and did institute, and in His holy gospel command us to continue, a perpetual memory of His precious death and sacrifice, until His coming again.  May this bread be to us the body of Christ, given to nourish and sustain the people of God in all ages.  Through Jesus Christ our Lord.  Amen.
2023-08-20.Line 580: Holy Scripture says that our Lord Jesus on the same night in which He was betrayed took bread
2023-08-20.Line 582: BREAKING AND DISTRIBUTION OF THE BREAD
2023-08-20.Line 634: And when He had blessed the bread, He broke it and gave it to His disciples saying: "Take, eat; this is My body which is broken for you; do this in remembrance of Me."
2023-08-20.Line 636: The body of Christ given for you!
2023-08-20.Line 640: Prayer giving thanks for the cup #6 (Adapted from The Book of Common Prayer)
2023-08-20.Line 641: O Lord, our heavenly Father, according to the kind command of Your dearly beloved Son our Savior Jesus Christ, we Your humble servants, celebrate before Your Divine Majesty, with these Your holy gifts, which we now offer to You, the memorial Your Son has commanded us to make, remembering His blessed passion and precious death, His mighty resurrection and glorious ascension; giving to You most hearty thanks for the innumerable benefits procured to us by those sufferings, death, resurrection, and ascension.  May this cup be to us the blood of Christ, given to nourish and sustain the people of God in all ages.  Through Jesus Christ our Lord.  Amen.
2023-08-20.Line 643: In the same manner He also took the cup also after supper
2023-08-20.Line 646: DISTRIBUTION OF THE CUP  . When I Survey the Wondrous Cross
2023-08-20.Line 671: Jesus said, "This cup is the new covenant in My blood. This do, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of Me."  For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you show forth your Lord's death until His return.
2023-08-20.Line 673: The blood of Christ shed for you!
2023-08-20.Line 679: O Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good!                                              For everlasting is His lovingkindness!
2023-08-20.Line 682: Praise God from whom all blessing flow,                                                                                       Praise Him all creatures here below                                                                                                                                         Praise Him above ye heavenly host,                                                                                                                                           Praise Father, Son, and Holy Ghost. Amen!
2023-08-20.Line 690: "Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day, and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.  And you are witnesses of these things.
2023-08-20.Line 698: and may your spirit and soul and body
2023-08-20.Line 700: at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
2023-08-20.Line 701: He who calls you is faithful,
2023-08-20.Line 759: God bless you!  Go in peace, and the God of peace be with you!

2023-08-27.Line 3: THE LORD CALLS US  < God renews covenant with His people >
2023-08-27.Line 5: HEB 4- we do not have a High Priest who cannot be touched with the feelings of our infirmities,  but has been tempted in all points as we have, yet without sin.  Let us therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need.
2023-08-27.Line 8: Rise and let us worship God! We are gathered in the name of God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy Spirit.    AMEN.
2023-08-27.Line 9: O magnify the Lord with me!                                                                                                                                  LET US EXALT GOD'S NAME TOGETHER!
2023-08-27.Line 10: I will praise you, O Lord, with my whole heart.                                                                                                                    I WILL TELL OF ALL YOUR MARVELOUS WORKS.
2023-08-27.Line 11: I will be glad and rejoice in you;
2023-08-27.Line 12: I WILL SING PRAISE TO YOUR NAME, O MOST HIGH!
2023-08-27.Line 17: I will praise You with my whole heart;
2023-08-27.Line 18: BEFORE THE GODS I WILL SING PRAISES TO YOU.
2023-08-27.Line 20: I will worship toward Your holy temple,
2023-08-27.Line 21: AND PRAISE YOUR NAME FOR YOUR LOVINGKINDNESS AND YOUR TRUTH;
2023-08-27.Line 23: For you have magnified your word
2023-08-27.Line 26: In the day when I cried out, You answered me,
2023-08-27.Line 27: AND MADE ME BOLD WITH STRENGTH IN MY SOUL.
2023-08-27.Line 29: All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O Lord,
2023-08-27.Line 30: WHEN THEY HEAR THE WORDS OF YOUR MOUTH.
2023-08-27.Line 32: Yes, they shall sing of  the ways of the Lord,
2023-08-27.Line 33: FOR GREAT IS THE GLORY OF THE LORD.
2023-08-27.Line 35: Though the Lord is on high, yet he regards the lowly;
2023-08-27.Line 36: BUT THE PROUD HE KNOWS FROM AFAR.
2023-08-27.Line 38: Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
2023-08-27.Line 41: You will stretch out Your hand
2023-08-27.Line 42: AGAINST THE WRATH OF MY ENEMIES,
2023-08-27.Line 44: And your right hand will save me.
2023-08-27.Line 45: THE LORD WILL PERFECT THAT WHICH CONCERNS ME;
2023-08-27.Line 47: Your mercy, O Lord, endures forever;
2023-08-27.Line 48: DO NOT FORSAKE THE WORKS OF YOUR HANDS.
2023-08-27.Line 49: Entrance Hymn               Psalm 138, With Grateful Heart My Thanks I Bring
2023-08-27.Line 65: We do bless You now, our LORD, help us to do so at all times;
2023-08-27.Line 66: So that we learn to boast, but only in You Who are the joy of the humble;
2023-08-27.Line 67: We seek You now, Father, so hear us and deliver us from all our fears,
2023-08-27.Line 68: Save us from our our troubles, surround and deliver us.
2023-08-27.Line 69: Help us to taste and see Your goodness and the blessedness of each one who trusts in You.  Now hear us as we sing the prayer Your Son has taught us to pray:
2023-08-27.Line 74: Our Father, who art in Heaven,
2023-08-27.Line 77: Thy will be done, on earth as it is in Heaven.
2023-08-27.Line 78: Give us this day our daily bread,
2023-08-27.Line 79: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive, our debtors.
2023-08-27.Line 80: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.
2023-08-27.Line 81: For Thine is the Kingdom, and the Power, and the Glory.
2023-08-27.Line 86: Saints of God, we are in need of cleansing and renewal. Let us call upon the mercy of our heavenly Father.  Let us kneel and confess our sins together, in humble reliance upon the grace of God, first silently, then together.
2023-08-27.Line 90: Most merciful God, we confess that we have sinned against You in thought, word, and deed, by what we have done and by what we have left undone.  We have not loved You with our whole heart; we have not loved our neighbor as ourselves.  For the sake of Your Son, Jesus Christ, have mercy on us.  Forgive us, renew us, and lead us, so that we may delight in Your will and walk in Your ways, to the glory of Your holy name.  Amen.
2023-08-27.Line 93: Arise and hear the good news of God's forgiveness!    Psalm 103:8-12
2023-08-27.Line 94: The Lord is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abounding in steadfast love.  He will not always chide, nor will He keep His anger forever.  He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.  For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is His steadfast love toward those who fear Him; as far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.
2023-08-27.Line 95: [To all who confess your sin to God and seek His forgiveness, God declares that He does not deal with you according to your sin or reward you as your iniquities deserve, but has removed your transgressions as far from you as the east is from the west. Christian, for Christ's sake, all your sins are forgiven.  Therefore, lift up your hearts!]
2023-08-27.Line 97: Leader: Lift up your hearts!   We lift them up to the Lord!
2023-08-27.Line 109: How Shall We Then Live?  Let us hear from God's Word.
2023-08-27.Line 178: Listen to Me, you who follow after righteousness, You who seek the Lord: Look to the rock from which you were hewn, And to the hole of the pit from which you were dug. 2 Look to Abraham your father, And to Sarah who bore you; For I called him alone, And blessed him and increased him.
2023-08-27.Line 179: 3 For the Lord will comfort Zion, He will comfort all her waste places; He will make her wilderness like Eden, And her desert like the garden of the Lord; Joy and gladness will be found in it, Thanksgiving and the voice of melody.
2023-08-27.Line 180: 4  Listen to Me, My people; And give ear to Me, O My nation: For law will proceed from Me, And I will make My justice rest As a light of the peoples. 5 My righteousness is near, My salvation has gone forth, And My arms will judge the peoples; The coastlands will wait upon Me, And on My arm they will trust. 6 Lift up your eyes to the heavens, And look on the earth beneath. For the heavens will vanish away like smoke, The earth will grow old like a garment, And those who dwell in it will die in like manner; But My salvation will be forever, And My righteousness will not be abolished.
2023-08-27.Line 183: The Word of the Lord!                 Thanks be to God!
2023-08-27.Line 189: 33 Oh, the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are His judgments and His ways past finding out!
2023-08-27.Line 190: 34  For who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has become His counselor? 35  Or who has first given to Him And it shall be repaid to him?
2023-08-27.Line 191: 36 For of Him and through Him and to Him are all things, to whom be glory forever. Amen.
2023-08-27.Line 192: 12 I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service. 2 And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God.3 For I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone who is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, but to think soberly, as God has dealt to each one a measure of faith. 4 For as we have many members in one body, but all the members do not have the same function, 5 so we, being many, are one body in Christ, and individually members of one another. 6 Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, let us use them: if prophecy, let us prophesy in proportion to our faith; 7 or ministry, let us use it in our ministering; he who teaches, in teaching; 8 he who exhorts, in exhortation; he who gives, with liberality; he who leads, with diligence; he who shows mercy, with cheerfulness.
2023-08-27.Line 195: The Word of the Lord!    Thanks be to God!
2023-08-27.Line 249: (Please remain standing for our Gospel Lesson and song)
2023-08-27.Line 259: Praise be to the Lord Jesus Christ!
2023-08-27.Line 263: Glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Ghost!
2023-08-27.Line 264: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be.
2023-08-27.Line 268: Father, we are so often distracted by the world and by our unbelief. Cause us to cling to belief in Jesus Christ whom you have sent, that we may never hunger and never thirst. Amen
2023-08-27.Line 390: Command those who are rich in this present age not to be haughty, nor to trust in uncertain riches but in the living God, who gives us richly all things to enjoy. Let them do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to give, willing to share, storing up for themselves a good foundation for the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.
2023-08-27.Line 392: Our Gracious Heavenly Father, thank You for giving us so richly all things to enjoy.  With these blessings grant us also the grace of Your Holy Spirit to repent of every form of sinful pride and the folly of trusting in uncertain riches.  You are the Living God.  In You is all our pride and all our trust.  Make us all rich in good works and charitable giving and everlasting life.  Receive and bless our offerings today in the name of Your Son Jesus Christ.  AMEN.
2023-08-27.Line 443: Now rise! And let us pray for the Church and the world!
2023-08-27.Line 447: We praise You for the steadfastness of your love toward us; for the extravagance of Your goodness to all of creation, from the smallest most frail and common place creatures to the greatest among mankind.  You know the needs we possess before we even think to pray about them or even are aware of them in the first place.  Truly you are nearer to us than we are to ourselves.  So hear our prayers and let your steadfast love, O LORD, be upon us, even as we hope in You.   For from You and through You and to You are all things.
2023-08-27.Line 449: We pray these things not only for ourselves but for all your Church in all the world.
2023-08-27.Line 450: In our own community, we lift up to You  Westminster Presbyterian Church and retired pastor Bill Tyson, Chad Watkins.  Would You continue to grant them Your blessing, protect them from harm and divisions keep them and guide them in Your truth by Your Spirit.  Empower them to be wise and faithful in ministry and bless them to know Your peace and joy and to see the fruit from their ministry labors.
2023-08-27.Line 452: Outside of our community, we lift up to You our brothers and sisters in the NIGERIA where so many of Your Children are persecuted and abducted and killed.  We pray that You would be their Refuge, Strength, and very present help in this time of trouble.  Give them the wisdom of serpents and the innocence of doves.  Grant to them just judges and officials who will fulfill their duty under You to protect the innocent and punish the wicked.  Be gracious to defend Your Bride, the Church, there in that Land and raise Her up in glorious triumph.
2023-08-27.Line 454: Father, also bless Your churches, ministers, refugees, and those caring for them in Russia, Ukraine, and border regions.  Bring a swift end to all hostilities and grant Your people across that region true unity in the Holy Spirit.  Please protect Your ministers especially in Russia where they minister under threat and State pressure.  Encourage them, provide for them, and give them daily measures of Your wisdom to remain faithful in the midst of this crisis.
2023-08-27.Line 456: OH LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-08-27.Line 459: How kind You are, Dear Father, to be especially present with Your people in our sufferings, sanctifying them for our good and Your glory.
2023-08-27.Line 460: We lift up to You those who are afflicted by all manner of suffering.
2023-08-27.Line 486: As well as each one we name before You now in our silent prayers
2023-08-27.Line 488: We give You thanks and ask Your protection for of our expectant mothers
2023-08-27.Line 492: Britney Schaeffer, Julie Alldredge, Sarah Mosley, Lauren Russo, Laura Dalton and Erika Dahl - together with their unborn children.
2023-08-27.Line 494: Hear also the prayers of those who desire children for the blessing of their homes and Your greater glory.
2023-08-27.Line 496: Good Shepherd, heal Your sheep and tend Your Lambs.
2023-08-27.Line 498: OH LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-08-27.Line 501: Gracious Father, You are the Lord of life.  You have made all of Creation and then mankind in Your holy image, to live in loving communion with You and one another, giving You glory, honor and praise, and in faithful stewardship and dominion over Creation.  But we have sinned against You and fallen short of these things.  We have turned from You and misused Your good gifts in Creation.  So we lift up to You all those in our nation and community ensnared by drunkenness and substance abuse and addiction, together with their loved ones.
2023-08-27.Line 503: Grant that in their desperation, they would seek and find You, and so find light, hope, power, freedom, and life through faith in Your Son and the gift of Your Holy Spirit.  Grant wisdom, strength, and faithfulness to Your Church here as we encounter and minister to these ones and their families, empower also our community leaders, law makers and enforcers, judges, and counselors.   Bless and guide Your people that we might build and maintain a holy culture among ourselves and life together in which gluttonies, addictions, and abuses have no fit or place.  Guard and defend us from all such temptations and truly deliver us from evil.
2023-08-27.Line 505: LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-08-27.Line 508: And now, our Heavenly Father, As we approach Your Word and the table You have set before us, grant us grace and soft hearts to love and trust in Christ Jesus, For we ask all in His strong and holy name. Amen
2023-08-27.Line 514: Christians, in Whom do you trust?
2023-08-27.Line 517: I believe in one God: the Father Almighty,
2023-08-27.Line 519: and of all things visible and invisible;
2023-08-27.Line 521: And in one Lord, Jesus Christ, the only-begotten Son of God,
2023-08-27.Line 522: begotten of His Father before all worlds,
2023-08-27.Line 523: God of God, Light of Light, very God of very God,
2023-08-27.Line 525: being of one substance with the Father;
2023-08-27.Line 526: by Whom all things were made;
2023-08-27.Line 527: Who for us men, and for our salvation,
2023-08-27.Line 529: and was incarnate by the Holy Ghost of the virgin, Mary,
2023-08-27.Line 531: and was crucified also for us under Pontius Pilate;
2023-08-27.Line 534: He rose again according to the Scriptures;
2023-08-27.Line 536: and sitteth at the right hand of the Father;
2023-08-27.Line 537: and He shall come again with glory
2023-08-27.Line 538: to judge both the quick and the dead;
2023-08-27.Line 539: Whose kingdom shall have no end.
2023-08-27.Line 541: And I believe in the Holy Ghost, the Lord and Giver of life,
2023-08-27.Line 542: Who proceedeth from the Father and the Son;
2023-08-27.Line 543: Who with the Father and the Son
2023-08-27.Line 547: And I believe one, holy, catholic, and apostolic Church;
2023-08-27.Line 548: I acknowledge one baptism for the remission of sins;
2023-08-27.Line 549: and I look for the resurrection of the dead,
2023-08-27.Line 550: and the life of the world to come.
2023-08-27.Line 607: in the name of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.  Amen.  Let us pray:
2023-08-27.Line 609: #7 PRAYER GIVING THANKS FOR THE BREAD: O Christ, You are the bread of life; our fathers ate the manna in the desert; You gave them bread from heaven to eat.  Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and are dead.   Moses did not give them the bread from heaven, but the Father gives the true bread from heaven. For the bread of God is He who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world. Lord, give us this bread always.  You, O Christ, are the bread of life. He who comes to you shall never hunger, and he who believes in you shall never thirst.  This is the bread which comes down from heaven, that one may eat of it and not die.  You are the living bread which came down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever; and the bread that you give is Your flesh, which you gave for the life of the world.  Feed us, we pray, this day; for we come to the Father in Your name.  Amen.
2023-08-27.Line 613: Holy Scripture says that our Lord Jesus on the same night in which He was betrayed took bread
2023-08-27.Line 615: BREAKING AND DISTRIBUTION OF THE BREAD
2023-08-27.Line 634: Bread                          Jesus Christ, Our Blessed Savior
2023-08-27.Line 684: And when He had blessed the bread, He broke it and gave it to His disciples saying: "Take, eat; this is My body which is broken for you; do this in remembrance of Me."
2023-08-27.Line 687: The body of Christ given for you!
2023-08-27.Line 691: #7 PRAYER GIVING THANKS FOR THE CUP: O Christ, You are the true wine from heaven.  For your flesh is food indeed, and Your blood is drink indeed. He who eats your flesh and drinks Your blood abides in You, and You in him. As the living Father sent you, and You live because of the Father, so he who feeds on You will live because of You.  We thank you for this cup.  As we drink of it, we say to you, O Father,  Christ died for me; I am trusting in Him.  In Jesus' name.  Amen.
2023-08-27.Line 693: In the same manner He also took the cup also after supper
2023-08-27.Line 724: Jesus said, "This cup is the new covenant in My blood. This do, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of Me."  For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you show forth your Lord's death until His return.
2023-08-27.Line 726: The blood of Christ shed for you!
2023-08-27.Line 731: O give thanks to the Lord, for He is good.
2023-08-27.Line 748: Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day, and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.  And you are witnesses of these things.
2023-08-27.Line 752: The peace of God which passes all understanding,
2023-08-27.Line 753: guard your hearts and minds in the knowledge and love of God,
2023-08-27.Line 754: and of His Son Jesus Christ our Lord;
2023-08-27.Line 755: and the blessing of God Almighty,
2023-08-27.Line 756: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit,
2023-08-27.Line 757: be upon you and remain with you always.  Amen.
2023-08-27.Line 839: God bless you!  Go in peace, and the God of peace be with you!

2023-09-03.Line 5: PS29 The LORD gives strength to His people!  The LORD will bless His people with peace.
2023-09-03.Line 6: So give to the LORD the glory due His name;
2023-09-03.Line 7: Worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness!
2023-09-03.Line 11: Rise and let us worship God! We are gathered in the name of God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy Spirit.                                                                                                                                                               AMEN.                                                                                                                                                                             O magnify the Lord with me!                                                                                                                                  LET US EXALT GOD'S NAME TOGETHER!
2023-09-03.Line 12: I will praise you, O Lord, with my whole heart.                                                                                                                    I WILL TELL OF ALL YOUR MARVELOUS WORKS.
2023-09-03.Line 13: I will be glad and rejoice in you;
2023-09-03.Line 14: I WILL SING PRAISE TO YOUR NAME, O MOST HIGH!
2023-09-03.Line 18: Vindicate me, O Lord, for I have walked in my integrity.
2023-09-03.Line 19: I HAVE ALSO TRUSTED IN THE LORD; I SHALL NOT SLIP.
2023-09-03.Line 21: Examine me, O Lord, and prove me; try my mind and my heart.
2023-09-03.Line 22: FOR YOUR LOVINGKINDNESS IS BEFORE MY EYES, AND I HAVE WALKED IN YOUR TRUTH.
2023-09-03.Line 24: I have not sat with idolatrous mortals, nor will I go in with hypocrites.
2023-09-03.Line 25: I HAVE HATED THE ASSEMBLY OF EVILDOERS, AND WILL NOT SIT WITH THE WICKED.
2023-09-03.Line 27: I will wash my hands in innocence; so I will go about your altar, O LORD,
2023-09-03.Line 28: THAT I MAY PROCLAIM WITH THE VOICE OF THANKSGIVING,
2023-09-03.Line 29: AND TELL OF ALL YOUR WONDROUS WORKS.
2023-09-03.Line 31: Lord, I have loved the habitation of Your house, and the place where Your glory dwells.
2023-09-03.Line 32: DO NOT GATHER MY SOUL WITH SINNERS, NOR MY LIFE WITH BLOODTHIRSTY MEN,
2023-09-03.Line 34: In whose hands is a sinister scheme, and whose right hand is full of bribes.
2023-09-03.Line 35: BUT AS FOR ME, I WILL WALK IN MY INTEGRITY; REDEEM ME AND BE MERCIFUL TO ME.
2023-09-03.Line 37: My foot stands in an even place;
2023-09-03.Line 38: IN THE CONGREGATIONS I WILL BLESS THE LORD.
2023-09-03.Line 42: Entrance Hymn      Beneath the Blood-Stained Lintel
2023-09-03.Line 85: Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one! You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your strength. And these words which I command you today shall be in your heart. You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, when you walk by the way, when you lie down, and when you rise up  For the promise is to you and to your children, and to all who are afar off, as many as the Lord our God will call.
2023-09-03.Line 88: DEARLY BELOVED, the sacrament of baptism is for little children because God our Father, Who has redeemed us by the sacrifice of Christ, is also the God and Father of our children.  They belong, with us who believe, to the membership of the Church through the covenant made with Christ. Our own Westminster Confession of Faith says that baptism is a sign and seal of the covenant of grace, of our ingrafting into Christ, of regeneration, of remission of sins, and of our giving up unto God, through Jesus Christ, to walk in the newness of life.
2023-09-03.Line 90: Our Lord Jesus said,  Allow the little children to come unto Me, and do not forbid them, for of such is the kingdom of God.
2023-09-03.Line 92: John and Blake, is Jesus Christ your only Lord and Savior?
2023-09-03.Line 94: You know that, in presenting your son, that God requires things of you
2023-09-03.Line 96: 1.        In presenting your son for baptism, you are acknowledging your need and his of the cleansing blood of Jesus Christ and the renewing grace of the Holy Spirit.
2023-09-03.Line 98: 2.    You are claiming God's covenant promise in his behalf, God's promise to be a God to you and to your descendants after you, and you are looking in faith to the Lord Jesus Christ for his salvation, as you do for your own.
2023-09-03.Line 100: 3.    You are now unreservedly committing him to God, and promising, in humble reliance upon divine grace, that you will endeavor to set before him a Godly example, that you will pray with and for her, that you will teach him the doctrines of the Christian faith, and that you will strive, by all the means of God's appointment, to bring him up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
2023-09-03.Line 101: These are the baptismal duties God requires of you do you vow to obey Him by His grace and help?  [response: We do]
2023-09-03.Line 103: QUESTION TO THE CONGREGATION: God calls you as the Body of Christ to assist these parents in the Christian nurture of this child? Will you respond with a hearty  Amen and commit to undertake this responsibility by God's grace and help?
2023-09-03.Line 109: Jacob Kendall,  I BAPTIZE YOU IN THE NAME OF THE FATHER AND THE SON AND THE HOLY SPIRIT.
2023-09-03.Line 111: THE BLESSINGS OF THE TRIUNE GOD BE WITH YOU ALWAYS.
2023-09-03.Line 115: Little boy, for you Jesus Christ came into the world,
2023-09-03.Line 117: For you He faced the blackness of Gethsemane and the terrors of Calvary.
2023-09-03.Line 118: For you He cried out  It is finished!
2023-09-03.Line 119: For you He overcame death by death, was buried, and ascended into Heaven, where for you, He is right now, interceding.
2023-09-03.Line 120: All these things while you are too young to even know what they mean. And so the word of the Apostle is confirmed:
2023-09-03.Line 121: We love Him because first, He loved us.
2023-09-03.Line 125: This child, being thus baptized, is a member of the household of faith; committed to the care and instruction of these parents and this congregation, to the end that he may mature and grow strong as a disciple of the Lord Jesus Christ, and serve in the royal priesthood of God's elect from every tribe and tongue and nation. Jesus said,  Whoever receives one such little child in My name, receives Me.
2023-09-03.Line 126: As you have seen this baptism, remember your own and vimprove and make right use of your baptism,
2023-09-03.Line 127: stir up your faith; nurture it; feed it; exercise it; strengthen it and always be repenting of any sins against your covenant with God for there is a covenant sealed by your baptism betwixt God and your soul.  Never forget it.  It is a great honor and gift to belong to God in this way.
2023-09-03.Line 129: Please rise for our prayer of blessing which we will close together by singing of the Lord's Prayer:
2023-09-03.Line 132: You righteously judged the unfaithful world through flood waters, but in Your great mercy, saved faithful Noah with his household.
2023-09-03.Line 134: You drowned hard-hearted Pharaoh with all his army in the Sea, but led Your people Israel through on dry ground, prefiguring the washing of Your holy baptism.
2023-09-03.Line 135: By the baptism of Your dear Son, You sanctified and set apart the Jordan River and all water for a saving flood, and an ample washing away of sins.
2023-09-03.Line 137: Through Your same infinite mercy, graciously look down now upon Jesse, and bless him with a right faith in the Spirit, so that through this saving flood all that was born in him from Adam and all that has been added to it might be drowned and cleansed.
2023-09-03.Line 139: Separate Jacob now from the unfaithful, and preserve him in the holy ark of Christendom dry and safe, ever fervent in spirit and joyful in hope to serve Your holy name,
2023-09-03.Line 140: so that he, together with us and all Your Faithful, may worthily inherit Your promise of eternal life, through Christ Jesus our Lord.
2023-09-03.Line 142: Now hear us as we sing the prayer He taught us:
2023-09-03.Line 145: We Praise You our God, for Your goodness, mercy, and wisdom.
2023-09-03.Line 146: You reject the evil and cut them off,
2023-09-03.Line 147: But turn Your eyes and ears to the righteous,
2023-09-03.Line 148: and save them out of all their troubles.
2023-09-03.Line 149: You condemn the wicked, but always redeem the souls of Your servants.
2023-09-03.Line 150: Yes, You turn and come near to the humble-hearted and repentant,
2023-09-03.Line 151: Just as You did Your Righteous Son, in all His afflictions,
2023-09-03.Line 152: While His very flesh was being torn,
2023-09-03.Line 153: You guarded each of His bones so that not one was broken.
2023-09-03.Line 154: So guard and be with us and hear us now as we sing together the prayer He has given us
2023-09-03.Line 156: Our Father, who art in Heaven,
2023-09-03.Line 159: Thy will be done, on earth as it is in Heaven.
2023-09-03.Line 160: Give us this day our daily bread,
2023-09-03.Line 161: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive, our debtors.
2023-09-03.Line 162: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.
2023-09-03.Line 163: For Thine is the Kingdom, and the Power, and the Glory.
2023-09-03.Line 167: Saints of God, we are in need of cleansing and renewal. Let us call upon the mercy of our heavenly Father.  Let us kneel and confess our sins together, in humble reliance upon the grace of God, first silently, then together.
2023-09-03.Line 171: Most merciful God, we confess that we have sinned against You in thought, word, and deed, by what we have done and by what we have left undone.  We have not loved You with our whole heart; we have not loved our neighbor as ourselves.  For the sake of Your Son, Jesus Christ, have mercy on us.  Forgive us, renew us, and lead us, so that we may delight in Your will and walk in Your ways, to the glory of Your holy name.  Amen.
2023-09-03.Line 175: Arise and hear the good news of God's forgiveness!     I JOHN 4:10
2023-09-03.Line 177: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that He loved us and sent His Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
2023-09-03.Line 179: [To all who confess your sin to God sincerely and seek His forgiveness, God declares His love for you, the love He made known by sending His Son, Who was the propitiation for our sins. Christian, for Christ's sake, all your sins are forgiven.  Therefore, lift up your hearts!]
2023-09-03.Line 181: Leader: Lift up your hearts!   We lift them up to the Lord!
2023-09-03.Line 187: How Shall We Then Live?  Let us hear from God's Word.
2023-09-03.Line 195: 15 O Lord, You know; Remember me and [a]visit me, And take vengeance for me on my persecutors. In Your enduring patience, do not take me away. Know that for Your sake I have suffered rebuke. 16 Your words were found, and I ate them, And Your word was to me the joy and rejoicing of my heart; For I am called by Your name, O Lord God of hosts. 17 I did not sit in the assembly of the mockers, Nor did I rejoice; I sat alone because of Your hand, For You have filled me with indignation. 18 Why is my pain perpetual And my wound incurable, Which refuses to be healed? Will You surely be to me like an unreliable stream, As waters that [b]fail?
2023-09-03.Line 197: If you return, Then I will bring you back; You shall stand before Me; If you take out the precious from the vile, You shall be as My mouth. Let them return to you, But you must not return to them. 20 And I will make you to this people a fortified bronze wall; And they will fight against you, But they shall not prevail against you; For I am with you to save you And deliver you, says the Lord. 21  I will deliver you from the hand of the wicked, And I will redeem you from the grip of the terrible.
2023-09-03.Line 206: 9 Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor what is evil. Cling to what is good. 10 Be kindly affectionate to one another with brotherly love, in honor giving preference to one another; 11 not lagging in diligence, fervent in spirit, serving the Lord; 12 rejoicing in hope, patient[a] in tribulation, continuing steadfastly in prayer; 13 distributing to the needs of the saints, given[b] to hospitality.
2023-09-03.Line 207: 14 Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse. 15 Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep. 16 Be of the same mind toward one another. Do not set your mind on high things, but associate with the humble. Do not be wise in your own opinion.
2023-09-03.Line 208: 17 Repay no one evil for evil. Have[c] regard for good things in the sight of all men. 18 If it is possible, as much as depends on you, live peaceably with all men. 19 Beloved, do not avenge yourselves, but rather give place to wrath; for it is written,  Vengeance is Mine, I will repay, says the Lord. 20 Therefore
2023-09-03.Line 209: If your enemy is hungry, feed him; If he is thirsty, give him a drink; For in so doing you will heap coals of fire on his head.
2023-09-03.Line 210: 21 Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
2023-09-03.Line 289: (Please remain standing for our Gospel Lesson and song)
2023-09-03.Line 294: Praise be to the Lord Jesus Christ!
2023-09-03.Line 298: Glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Ghost!
2023-09-03.Line 299: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be.
2023-09-03.Line 307: Gracious Father in Heaven, grant us now hearts freed from worldliness, that we may hear and receive Your holy Word with all diligence and faith, to understand, cherish, and obey; through our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
2023-09-03.Line 311: Preaching of the Word    Pastor Ben Rossell
2023-09-03.Line 375: September 11th-Hebrews 6:10 -- God is not unjust to forget your work and labor of love which you have shown toward His name, in that you have ministered to the saints, and do minister.
2023-09-03.Line 377: Our Gracious Heavenly Father, You have called us to imitate those who imitated Christ Himself, who loved us and gave Himself for us (Gal.2:24).  And You have promised not to forget our work and labor of love as we minister to the saints.  Thank You for this precious promise and glorious calling.  Enable us by Your Spirit, even now, to give, to work, to pray for Your glory.  For we ask it in Jesus' name.  AMEN.
2023-09-03.Line 400: Now rise! And let us pray for the Church and the world!
2023-09-03.Line 402: Most merciful Father from whom come all the blessings of the light; and who in darkness still is near; all praise and thanks be unto You for all Your dealings with us which manifest Your goodness; as well as for those also in which Your love is hidden from our eyes. We thank You for Your holy Word delivered to Your Church; for the faith which it has conveyed to men from one generation to another; and for the mercies by which it has enlarged and comforted our souls. We ask now with boldness and humility that You would mercifully receive the prayers of Your people who call upon You in the name of Your dear Son.
2023-09-03.Line 404: Bless Your Church throughout all the world.
2023-09-03.Line 406: In our own community, we lift up to You: All God's Children and the Living Word and pastor Walter Williams.  We pray that they along with us would abound in love more and more with knowledge and all discernment, so that they might approve what is excellent, and so be pure and blameless before Christ.  Fill them with the fruit of righteousness that comes through Jesus to the glory and praise of God.
2023-09-03.Line 408: Outside our community, we lift up to You Your persecuted people all over the world, especially today asking Your mercy for our brothers and sisters in  ..Pakistan:
2023-09-03.Line 409: Protect Your people there in the midst of riots and attacks and persecution especially those who have converted to Christ and are rejected or assaulted for it.
2023-09-03.Line 410: Give your Minister's wisdom as they serve under so much pressure and danger grant fruit from their service.  Build up Your Church there and turn aside all who seek to harm Your people so that Your Church may worship in peace and devotion.
2023-09-03.Line 412: Father, also bless Your churches, ministers, refugees, and those caring for them in Russia, Ukraine, and border regions.  Bring a swift end to all hostilities and grant Your people across that region true unity in the Holy Spirit.
2023-09-03.Line 414: OH LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-09-03.Line 416: Yahweh, You are the Father of mercies and God of all comfort so we bring before You our suffering ones asking that You heal them and grant Your grace and comfort. Enable them to trust in You and to remember Your faithful promise never to leave or forsake them. Bless their suffering O Lord that it might sanctify them and make them shining examples of Your grace.
2023-09-03.Line 442: As well as each one we name before You now in our silent prayers
2023-09-03.Line 444: We give You thanks and ask Your protection for of our expectant mothers
2023-09-03.Line 446: Britney Schaeffer, Julie Alldredge, Sarah Mosley, Lauren Russo, Laura Dalton and Erika Dahl - together with their unborn children.
2023-09-03.Line 448: Hear also the prayers of those who desire children for the blessing of their homes and Your greater glory.
2023-09-03.Line 450: Good Shepherd, heal Your sheep and tend Your Lambs.
2023-09-03.Line 452: OH LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-09-03.Line 456: We lift up to You President Biden, his advisors, as well as our law makers and judges.  Give them Your wisdom, a clear sense of good and righteous judgment, and the conviction to govern rightly.  Help us to learn to honor them as the authority You have placed over us, while also fearing and obeying You as our ultimate Authority.
2023-09-03.Line 458: Bless our armed forces, we pray, that they may be used only in ways that conform to Your holy will. We entrust to Your care and protection our servicemen and women: Josh Stevenson; Trent Hamilton; Corban Pierce; Bobby Dixon; Austin & Bekah Denigan; Kent Winn, Pablo DeJesus, Shawn Lowe, Matt Adelstein, Chris Stanton, Lexi Turner, Braden Fitzsimmons, Nathaneal Trexler, and Zander Patterson.
2023-09-03.Line 462: LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-09-03.Line 466: Father, You are the God before whom all generations rise and pass away; You are the strength of those who labor and the repose of the blessed dead. We rejoice in the communion of the saints and rejoice to be partakers in that fellowship. Help us as we do so today and hear us in each of our petitions, for Jesus' sake.  Amen.-

2023-09-03.Line 507: and the life of the world to come.
2023-09-03.Line 570: We humbly beseech You, O merciful Father, to hear us; and because of Your almighty goodness bless and sanctify, with Your word and Spirit, these Your gifts and creations of bread and wine; that we, receiving them according to Your Son our Savior Jesus Christ's holy institution, in remembrance of His death and passion, may be partakers of His most blessed Body and Blood.  And we ask that in Your fatherly goodness, You will mercifully accept this our sacrifice of praise and thanksgiving; most humbly beseeching You to grant that, by the merits of death of your son Jesus Christ, and through faith in His blood, we and all Your whole Church, may obtain remission of our sins, and all other benefits of His passion.  And here we offer to You, O Lord, ourselves, our souls and bodies, to be a reasonable, holy , and living sacrifice to you.  Through Jesus Christ our Lord.  Amen.
2023-09-03.Line 574: Holy Scripture says that our Lord Jesus, on the same night in which He was betrayed, took bread

2023-09-03.Line 654: And when He had blessed the bread, He broke it and gave it to His disciples saying: "Take, eat; this is My body which is broken for you; do this in remembrance of Me."
2023-09-03.Line 656: The body of Christ given for you!
2023-09-03.Line 666: All glory be to You, Almighty God, our heavenly Father.  Because of Your tender mercy, You gave Your only Son Jesus Christ to suffer death on the cross for our redemption; and did institute, and in His holy gospel command us to continue, a perpetual memory of His precious death and sacrifice, until His coming again.  Therefore we Your humble servants, celebrate before Your Divine Majesty, with these Your holy gifts, which we now offer to You: the memorial Your Son has commanded us to make, remembering His blessed passion and precious death, His mighty resurrection and glorious ascension; giving to You most hearty thanks for the innumerable benefits procured to us by those sufferings, death, resurrection, and ascension, Who, together with You and the Holy Spirit, are worship and glorified as one God, now and forevermore.    Amen.

2023-09-10.Line 6: I would have lost heart, unless I had believed That I would see the goodness of the Lord In the land of the living. Wait on the Lord; Be of good courage, And He shall strengthen your heart; Wait, I say, on the Lord!
2023-09-10.Line 7: Rise and Let us worship God! We are gathered in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen!

2023-09-10.Line 23: Gracious Father in Heaven, You are our light and salvation. You are our fortress so that we may rightly be brave in this life, rather than fearful. Even when our enemies assail us, You bring them to destruction. Give us that true courage from Your Spirit, shelter us in our day of trouble and shield us in Your Son Who tabernacled among us and for us. Make us to dwell in Him all the days of our lives to gaze upon Your beauty and meditate upon Your Word. Now hear us as we sing the prayer He has given us:
2023-09-10.Line 27: Our Father, who art in Heaven,
2023-09-10.Line 30: Thy will be done, on earth as it is in Heaven.
2023-09-10.Line 31: Give us this day our daily bread,
2023-09-10.Line 32: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive, our debtors.
2023-09-10.Line 33: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.
2023-09-10.Line 34: For Thine is the Kingdom, and the Power, and the Glory.
2023-09-10.Line 37: Saints of God, we are in need of cleansing and renewal. Let us call upon the mercy of our heavenly Father. Let us kneel and confess our sins together, in humble reliance upon the grace of God, first silently, then together.
2023-09-10.Line 41: Most merciful God, we confess that we have sinned against You in thought, word, and deed, by what we have done and by what we have left undone.  We have not loved You with our whole heart; we have not loved our neighbor as ourselves.  For the sake of Your Son, Jesus Christ, have mercy on us.  Forgive us, renew us, and lead us, so that we may delight in Your will and walk in Your ways, to the glory of Your holy name.  Amen.
2023-09-10.Line 43: Arise!   and hear the good news of God's forgiveness from Isaiah chapter 1: Come now, and let us reason together," says the Lord, Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool."
2023-09-10.Line 44: To you, who have confessed your sins, believing in Jesus, the Father declares to you that they are forgiven, and that for His sake, though you were deeply stained in scarlet, by Christ's blood, you are as snowy white wool and for Christ's sake, your sin is forgiven!
2023-09-10.Line 47: We lift them up to the Lord!
2023-09-10.Line 96: And it shall be, when you come into the land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you possess it and dwell in it, 2 that you shall take some of the first of all the produce of the ground, which you shall bring from your land that the Lord your God is giving you, and put it in a basket and go to the place where the Lord your God chooses to make His name abide. 3 And you shall go to the one who is priest in those days, and say to him, ‘I declare today to the Lord your God that I have come to the country which the Lord swore to our fathers to give us.'
2023-09-10.Line 97: 4  Then the priest shall take the basket out of your hand and set it down before the altar of the Lord your God. 5 And you shall answer and say before the Lord your God: ‘My father was a Syrian, about to perish, and he went down to Egypt and dwelt there, few in number; and there he became a nation, great, mighty, and populous. 6 But the Egyptians mistreated us, afflicted us, and laid hard bondage on us.
2023-09-10.Line 98: 7 Then we cried out to the Lord God of our fathers, and the Lord heard our voice and looked on our affliction and our labor and our oppression. 8 So the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and with an outstretched arm, with great terror and with signs and wonders. 9 He has brought us to this place and has given us this land,  a land flowing with milk and honey; 10 and now, behold, I have brought the firstfruits of the land which you, O Lord, have given me.'
2023-09-10.Line 99: Then you shall set it before the Lord your God, and worship before the Lord your God. 11 So you shall rejoice in every good thing which the Lord your God has given to you and your house, you and the Levite and the stranger who is among you.
2023-09-10.Line 103: The Word of the Lord!   Thanks be to God!
2023-09-10.Line 111: For whom the Lord loves He chastens, And scourges every son whom He receives.
2023-09-10.Line 112: 7 If you endure chastening, God deals with you as with sons; for what son is there whom a father does not chasten? 8 But if you are without chastening, of which all have become partakers, then you are illegitimate and not sons. 9 Furthermore, we have had human fathers who corrected us, and we paid them respect. Shall we not much more readily be in subjection to the Father of spirits and live?
2023-09-10.Line 113: 10 For they indeed for a few days chastened us as seemed best to them, but He for our profit, that we may be partakers of His holiness. 11 Now no chastening seems to be joyful for the present, but painful; nevertheless, afterward it yields the peaceable fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.
2023-09-10.Line 114: 12 Therefore strengthen the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees, 13 and make straight paths for your feet, so that what is lame may not be dislocated, but rather be healed.
2023-09-10.Line 115: 14 Pursue peace with all people, and holiness, without which no one will see the Lord: 15 looking carefully lest anyone fall short of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up cause trouble, and by this many become defiled; 16 lest there be any fornicator or profane person like Esau, who for one morsel of food sold his birthright. 17 For you know that afterward, when he wanted to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, for he found no place for repentance, though he sought it diligently with tears.
2023-09-10.Line 116: 18 For you have not come to the mountain that may be touched and that burned with fire, and to blackness and darkness and tempest, 19 and the sound of a trumpet and the voice of words, so that those who heard it begged that the word should not be spoken to them anymore.
2023-09-10.Line 117: 20 (For they could not endure what was commanded:  And if so much as a beast touches the mountain, it shall be stoned or shot with an arrow. 21 And so terrifying was the sight that Moses said,  I am exceedingly afraid and trembling.)
2023-09-10.Line 118: 22 But you have come to Mount Zion and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, to an innumerable company of angels, 23 to the general assembly and church of the firstborn who are registered in heaven, to God the Judge of all, to the spirits of just men made perfect, 24 to Jesus the Mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better things than that of Abel.
2023-09-10.Line 119: 25 See that you do not refuse Him who speaks. For if they did not escape who refused Him who spoke on earth, much more shall we not escape if we turn away from Him who speaks from heaven, 26 whose voice then shook the earth; but now He has promised, saying,  Yet once more I shake not only the earth, but also heaven. 27 Now this,  Yet once more, indicates the removal of those things that are being shaken, as of things that are made, that the things which cannot be shaken may remain.
2023-09-10.Line 120: 28 Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom which cannot be shaken, let us have grace, by which we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear. 29 For our God is a consuming fire.
2023-09-10.Line 139: Now RISE for our Gospel Reading and song
2023-09-10.Line 144: Praise be to the Lord Jesus Christ!
2023-09-10.Line 153: Glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Ghost!
2023-09-10.Line 154: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be.
2023-09-10.Line 157: Our Father in Heaven, Without You, we can do nothing. I will speak long empty words without knowledge and my hearers will grow dull and restless, our minds will wander and our hearts grow lukewarm. So give us the grace of Your Spirit and His light and warmth to hear, believe, obey, and love Your words. For we ask in the name of our Lord Jesus, Who spoke them and by Your Spirit. Amen.
2023-09-10.Line 222: Hebrews 13:1-3,16 -- Let brotherly love continue.  Do not forget to entertain strangers, for by so doing some have unwittingly entertained angels.  Remember the prisoners as if chained with them -- those who are mistreated -- since you yourselves are in the body also....But do not forget to do good and to share, for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.
2023-09-10.Line 224: Our Gracious Heavenly Father, You have told us that what we do for the least of Your brothers, we do for You the feeding of the hungry and thirsty, the welcoming of a stranger, the clothing of the naked, the visiting of the sick or persecuted (Matt.25:35).  Deliver us from selfish indifference, and hardness of heart.  Instead give us Your heart to share what we have, our wealth, our homes, our time, our abilities and our energies to minster faithfully to the needs of those around us. Bless our offerings now, for we ask it in the name of the One Who had nowhere to lay His head, even Jesus Christ our Lord.  AMEN.
2023-09-10.Line 242: Rise now and let us pray for the Church and the World!
2023-09-10.Line 245: God, Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, Deliver us and our children from the wiles of the world, the flesh, and the devil. Deliver us from evil and temptation. Enable us to see and to understand how we ought to walk, not as fools but as wise, redeeming the time, and not participating in the evil around us. Help us as a people to love one another and so fulfill the law of Christ. Grant us understanding that we might never forsake the assembling of ourselves together as the manner of some is, so that we might take advantage of every opportunity to stir one another up unto love and good works.
2023-09-10.Line 247: We pray this not only for ourselves but for all Your Church in all the world.
2023-09-10.Line 249: In our own community, we lift up to You: New Hope Baptist Church and Pastor David Wilson   Would You grant them Your continued blessing cause Your Word to dwell in them richly build them up into strength and maturity in our most holy faith - and grant them the wisdom, righteousness, and gracious power of Your Spirit.
2023-09-10.Line 251: Outside our community, we lift up to You gospel ministry all over the world,
2023-09-10.Line 252: Especially the wonderful work of the Peru Mission For all who labor at the Mission especially Christ the King, Christ the Restorer, and Christ the Redeemer churchesGrant fruit from the summer's labors from the medical and mercy mission work that has taken place.  We thank You for it.  And for the success of Geneva School.  Bless especially their outreach and education ministry bring many to know Your Son and eternal life in Him through these students and their families.
2023-09-10.Line 254: We also lift up to You our persecuted brothers and sisters all over the world, especially in  ..EGYPT for  where wicked men harass Your people and hinder their work and lives and even good works like adoption. Our Lord Jesus has promised that it is better to be bound to a millstone and cast into the sea than to cause one of His little ones to stumble. So we pray that You would rise up and defend Your children. Protect and provide for them.  Grant them the peace of Your Spirit in the midst of this distress and turn those within the false religion of Islam to true light and life in Jesus Christ. Grant them leaders and authorities with wisdom, bravery, and justice as they respond. Holy God, Mighty and Immortal One, have mercy upon us.
2023-09-10.Line 256: Father, also bless Your churches, ministers, refugees, and those caring for them in Russia, Ukraine, and border regions.  In your mercy, bring a swift end to all hostilities and grant Your people across that region true unity in the Holy Spirit.
2023-09-10.Line 259: OH LORD, HEAR OUR PRAYERS.  For You are gracious.
2023-09-10.Line 262: How kind You are, Dear Father, to be especially present with Your people in our sufferings, sanctifying them for our good and Your glory.

2023-09-10.Line 365: Almighty and everlasting God, who by the blood of Your dear Son has consecrated for us a new and living way into the holiest of all; we pray that You will cleanse our minds by the inspiration of Your Holy Spirit, that we, Your redeemed people, drawing near to You at this table, with a true heart and undefiled conscience, in full assurance of faith, may offer unto You an acceptable sacrifice in righteousness. We thank You now, Heavenly Father, for this bread, the body of Christ for us today. Through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

2023-09-10.Line 421: Prayer giving thanks for the cup #9: (Adapted from The Order of Worship of the Reformed Church, 1899)
2023-09-10.Line 423: For all Your mercies and favors, known to us and unknown, we give You thanks. But most of all, we praise You, the Father everlasting, for the gift of Your adorable true and only Son, our Savior Jesus Christ, Who by His appearing has abolished death and brought life and immortality to light through the Gospel. We bless You for the giving of the Holy Spirit; for the institution of the Church; for the means of grace; for the hope of everlasting life; and for the glory which shall be brought to us at the coming, and in the kingdom of Your dear Son. We give You thanks now for His blood, shed for us and for the forgiveness of our sins. In Jesus' name. Amen.

2023-09-17.Line 126: You shall make an altar to burn incense on; you shall make it of acacia wood. 2 A cubit shall be its length and a cubit its width it shall be square and two cubits shall be its height. Its horns shall be of one piece with it. 3 And you shall overlay its top, its sides all around, and its horns with pure gold; and you shall make for it a molding of gold all around. 4 Two gold rings you shall make for it, under the molding on both its sides. You shall place them on its two sides, and they will be holders for the poles with which to bear it. 5 You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold. 6 And you shall put it before the veil that is before the ark of the Testimony, before the mercy seat that is over the Testimony, where I will meet with you.
2023-09-17.Line 127: 7  Aaron shall burn on it sweet incense every morning; when he tends the lamps, he shall burn incense on it. 8 And when Aaron lights the lamps at twilight, he shall burn incense on it, a perpetual incense before the Lord throughout your generations. 9 You shall not offer strange incense on it, or a burnt offering, or a grain offering; nor shall you pour a drink offering on it. 10 And Aaron shall make atonement upon its horns once a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonement; once a year he shall make atonement upon it throughout your generations. It is most holy to the Lord.
2023-09-17.Line 129: 34 And the Lord said to Moses:  Take sweet spices, stacte and onycha and galbanum, and pure frankincense with these sweet spices; there shall be equal amounts of each. 35 You shall make of these an incense, a compound according to the art of the perfumer, salted, pure, and holy. 36 And you shall beat some of it very fine, and put some of it before the Testimony in the tabernacle of meeting where I will meet with you. It shall be most holy to you. 37 But as for the incense which you shall make, you shall not make any for yourselves, according to its composition. It shall be to you holy for the Lord. 38 Whoever makes any like it, to smell it, he shall be cut off from his people.
2023-09-17.Line 139: 11 Therefore remember that you, once Gentiles in the flesh who are called Uncircumcision by what is called the Circumcision made in the flesh by hands  12 that at that time you were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope and without God in the world. 13 But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ.
2023-09-17.Line 140: 14 For He Himself is our peace, who has made both one, and has broken down the middle wall of separation, 15 having abolished in His flesh the enmity, that is, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, so as to create in Himself one new man from the two, thus making peace, 16 and that He might reconcile them both to God in one body through the cross, thereby putting to death the enmity. 17 And He came and preached peace to you who were afar off and to those who were near. 18 For through Him we both have access by one Spirit to the Father.
2023-09-17.Line 141: 19 Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God, 20 having been built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone, 21 in whom the whole building, being fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord, 22 in whom you also are being built together for a dwelling place of God in the Spirit.
2023-09-17.Line 143: The Word of the Lord!  Thanks be to God.
